name: Gran Hotel Bahia del Duque Resort

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: I've been meaning to write this review for 2 months as I wanted to rave and rave about how good it is. I don't have the time to do this so just trust me and do as we did and go and find out. It is amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh just one thing. Have a day a the Spa.
reviews.title: Our favourite Hotel, but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently enjoyed another lovely stay in the Bahia. If you want a totally relaxing week in the sun with a touch of class then come here. This was our seventh holiday here and it ticks all of our boxes. The surroundings are impressive and although the initial "WOW" might have worn off over the years we now think upon the hotel as an old friend that we look forward to returning to. Sure we have tried others and indeed do have other favourite hotels and destinations around the world but after a few disappointments we now generally stick to the ones that we know will give us the holiday that we want.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: I do have one comment though and as I can see that management do peruse these reviews I would like to offer an opinion.
reviews.title: Fantastic family vacation!

reviews.text: The first contact that one has at a 5 star hotel is usually with the porters as you exit a cab. The guys at the Bahia are excellant. They are wekcoming, friendly and smiley, indeed as we exited our cab we were recognised. I can only say from personal experiance that this does make a difference. You immediatly feel welcome and wanted.
reviews.title: Fantastic - as ever

reviews.text: We have just returned from this hotel and can't wait to return. The hotel setting is perfect, the swimming pools were constantly used by our 3 children. We did not have any problem getting a space by the pool, with staff always ready to help find sunloungers and parasols if needed. The kids club is excellent, special thanks must go to Helena!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The staff really make an effort to be friendly and cheerful. The only exception to this was a chef in the buffet, Silvario, who made our children cold pasta on one occasion ( the sauce was ice cold on top of the pasta), when we took it back he was quite rude and told us that " the plate was hot", not sure what he meant by this, but he was not happy! However not everyone can have a good night every night so it was no big deal. We did not find the food to be that great for the class of hotel. The biggest let down was the kids food at the Bar Azul, the fish fingers and chicken goujons were awful. I cut the fish fingers in half and found "grey" fish and lots of fat bubbling out in a white foam from the fish fingers, for 6-7 Euro they really should do better!
reviews.title: Great hotel, Lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But these were minor points in an otherwise perfect stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, extremely helpful staff

reviews.text: Ive just got back last night from staying here for 12 days and already missing the hotel with it free champagne at breakfast.
reviews.title: fabulous luxury hotel that caters for grandparents, parents and young children

reviews.text: When we first arrived to the hotel we were led to reception where we were check in. I was travelling with a friend but they had us down as husband and wife which as my friend was female was funny. We were told that our room was not ready and had to wait but we were given a free glas of wine each and had a sit down so no problem with that. We didnt have to wait long till we were taken to our room.
reviews.title: Nearly Perfect

reviews.text: We decided to push the boat out as we had not had a holiday the year before. We travelled with our two young children aged 2 1/2 and 1 yr old. We booked this hotel as it seemed to cater for both tastes, luxury for us and kids facilities. The reception we received was extremely friendly and the kids were given a little present of slippers which I thought was a nice touch and kept them amused whilst we checked in. I was disappointed with the room (no. 105) as it was in need of renovation (the tiles on the walls were dated 1993). Very dark furniture and some bad instances of DIY. Not what I expected for a five star hotel. The bath was not clean. Room was quite large though as we had to fit a cot in as well with a pull out sofa bed for our 2 1/2 yr old. The grounds are immaculate. We were expecting to be a bit more pampered for example offered cool towels around the pool, waiters offering drinks etc. If you wanted a drink round the pool you usually had to wait until someone else had been to the bar and the waiter delivered them then you had to catch his attention.
reviews.title: Not as expected

reviews.text: I have to disagree with the comments about the kids disco. We were there mid May for one week and there were two nights that were aimed at kids. The so called disco was a CD played with about 10 songs and actions done by one of the hotel staff. This lasted from 9.00-9.30 then it was dance shows and acrobats. If I was going on holiday without kids I would not choose a hotel from a family collection (as this hotel is) so the people complaining about kids should choose more wisely in future.
reviews.title: Outstanding great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food choice for kids was not good and a few of the restaurants were not open that may have catered for them.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Ruined...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When all is said and done it is a nice hotel but not outstanding as I was expecting. I think there are far superior hotels in the world that are actually five star. We did meet some nice people though.
reviews.title: If you don't have kids , don't stay here...

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week on the 21st may, what can i say its the best hotel we have ever stayed in the room was lovely we had a ground floor room with 2 sunbeds on, even the peacock seemed to like our room. The gardens and pools are lovely if you dont want to be near the children sit at the top swimming pool and its just as nice down at the main pool and the tents. We did not notice the chikdrens enterniement it was not a problem to us. The staff and service is outstanding they can not do enough for you the buffet resterant food is good and we tried the italian resturant to and the food was lovely there to. I could go on forever at how lovely and outstanding this hotel is we will be saving up to return to your hotel next year as its by far the best hotel we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Not for me

reviews.text: Our fourth trip to the Bahia del Duque and it's still a great place for us (a family of four) to stay. Plenty of pools to swim in (our kids go from one to the other all day), clean (pools are cleaned every day, always staff cleaning around and the rooms are more than adequate, if not exactly exciting), lots of things to do (tennis, fitness, fitness classes, entertainment for kids and grown-ups in the evening).
reviews.title: An excellent all-round resort hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are friendly and polite. I'd rather try somewhere else but the kids like coming here, even though they are now 17 and 14 (they find plenty of other kids of the same age, but this is a real family-orientated hotel so there's kids of all ages around).
reviews.title: no longer top class

reviews.text: Food is ok, but not great (especially the El Bernegal buffet where the quality of food and wine served is distinctly average but, again, the kids love going up and helping themselves to lots of different things), but there are lots of restaurants around the resort so you never get bored.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant.

reviews.text: Location is ok. Not exactly plush and inviting, but we never leave the resort complex anyway as it's so good (our one annual walk along the seafront into Playa de Las Football Shirt is usually enough to remind us why we don't).
reviews.title: A palace for children.. but for adults?

reviews.text: Plenty of poolside loungers as well. We are late risers as a family so don't participate in that tedious exercise of draping towels over our chosen loungers at 6am to make sure we have it for the day, but we rarely had trouble getting a lounger and umbrella later on.
reviews.title: Paradise!!!

aka: Gran Hotel Bahia Del Duque Adeje
description: Bahia del Duque is a charming hotel inspired by the traditional Canarian architecture of the end of the 19th Century. This adaptation of a tropical oasis rises majestically on the azure shores of the beautiful Duque Beach. Apart from the original 19 buildings of the resort, 40 exclusive villas designed by the prestigious interior decorator Pascua Ortega have been opened in January 2008. Additionally, the inauguration of the luxurious Spa is planned for this summer.
